text: Frank Billings Kellogg (December 22, 1856 â€“ December 21, 1937) was an American lawyer, politician and statesman. He served in the United States Senate and as United States Secretary of State. Kellogg was part of a group who wrote the Kellogg-Briand Pact also known as the World Peace Act. For this, he won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1929. ==References== Category:Lawyers from Minnesota Category:United States senators from New York (state) Category:United States Secretaries of State Category:American Nobel Prize winners Category:Politicians from Saint Paul, Minnesota Category:1856 births Category:1937 deaths Category:Lawyers from New York (state) Category:Ambassadors of the United States to the United Kingdom
title: Frank B. Kellogg
